pages.title: Horodyskia
pages.text: $(l)Temporal Range:$() Mesoproterozoic (Calymmian) - Neoproterozoic (Tonian)$(br2)$(l)Habitat:$() Marine$(br2)>Glomeromycota$(br)>Archaeosporales$(br)>Geosiphonaceae$(br)$(l)Method of Obtaining:$() Shears

Horodyskia is an enigmatic fossil from the Mesoproterozoic Era that resembles a string of pearls. It has been interepreted as a fungus or possibly a very early animal. Horodyskia fossils have been found in Austraila, China, and in North America.
